lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/hal.Hal.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run hal.Hal.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Main method that continues looping and accepting commands until user inputs 'bye'.

* @param input Input a string based on the text input by the user through CLI.
* @return a parsed list of string literals containing the description and timing components (if relevant).
* @throws HalException if format of input text is wrong.

* @return LocalDate object denotinng the specified date, or today's date if str is in the wrong format.

* @return LocalDate object in the format "EEEE, MMM d yyyy".
* Converts string to Task objects and vice versa.
* Parses the data so that they can be stored or read from memory.
* The function takes in an ArrayList of Task objects and converts them into a string.
* Each task is saved as a string in a new line.
* If no tasks exist, an empty string is returned.
* @param listTasks ListTasks an array of Task objects.
* @return savedString A String of the converted Task objects.
LocalDate taskTimings = LocalDate.now(); //defaults to current time

* It detects the type of task and parses it accordingly.
* If a string is not detected, null is returned.
* @param str Str a string read from local storage file.
* @return returns a Task object created from parsing str.
* Class that handles saving and loading data from local storage.

* Writes string version of Task object to the file data/hal.txt.
* @param str Str represents a string format of a Task object.
* Returns an ArrayList of Task objects.
* The file containing user data is read line by line, and the string is parsed and converted to a Task object.
* The tasks are then added to an arraylist and gets returned.
* If no tasks are saved, null is returned.
* Constructor to create a Deadline task.
* Constructor takes in the description and time when the deadline is due.
* @param description Description of the deadline type task.
* @param by Date when the deadline is due.
* Retrieves the date of the deadline.
* Sets the deadline of the task
* Constructor to create an Event task. Constructor takes in the description and time in which the event will occur.
* @param description Description of the event type task.
* @param at Date when the event will occur.
* Sets the date where the event task will occur.
* @param at Date when the event will occur.
* Retrieves the date where the event will occur
* @return String containing the date where the event will occur.
* Represents a generic task. A Task object contains a description, a type and a boolean flag,
* representing whether the task is done.
* Task is inherited by all other task objects.
* Creates a task with properties description, isdone and type
* @param type Type sets the type of the task
* Retrieves the description of the task.
* Retrieves the type of the task.
* Sets the description to the task.
* @param description Description to be added to the task.
* Returns true if the task is completed, false if not completed.
* Sets the current task to be completed or unfinished.
* @param done Boolean representing the status of the current task.
* Retrieves the current status of the task.
* Prints out a string representing the status; done or not done.
* @return string representing the status of the task
* Sets the current task as done
* Constructor of a to do. It takes in a description to be added to the task.
* @param description Description of the to do task.
* Public functions from HalUi is called when printing UI elements or error messages.
